allOf.description: Describes the event of a patient being administered a vaccination or a record of a vaccination as reported by a patient, a clinician or another party and may include vaccine reaction information and what vaccination protocol was followed.

identifier.description: A unique identifier assigned to this immunization record.

status.description: Indicates the current status of the vaccination event.

notGiven.description: Indicates if the vaccination was or was not given.

vaccineCode.description: Vaccine that was administered or was to be administered.

patient.description: The patient who either received or did not receive the immunization.

encounter.description: The visit or admission or other contact between patient and health care provider the immunization was performed as part of.

date.description: Date vaccine administered or was to be administered.

primarySource.description: An indication that the content of the record is based on information from the person who administered the vaccine. This reflects the context under which the data was originally recorded.

reportOrigin.description: The source of the data when the report of the immunization event is not based on information from the person who administered the vaccine.

location.description: The service delivery location where the vaccine administration occurred.

lotNumber.description: Lot number of the  vaccine product.

site.description: Body site where vaccine was administered.

route.description: The path by which the vaccine product is taken into the body.

doseQuantity.description: The quantity of vaccine product that was administered.

practitioner.description: Indicates who or what performed the event.

note.description: Extra information about the immunization that is not conveyed by the other attributes.

explanation.description: Reasons why a vaccine was or was not administered.

reaction.description: Categorical data indicating that an adverse event is associated in time to an immunization.

vaccinationProtocol.description: Contains information about the protocol(s) under which the vaccine was administered.

role.description: Describes the type of performance (e.g. ordering provider, administering provider, etc.).

actor.description: The device, practitioner, etc. who performed the action.

reason.description: Reasons why a vaccine was administered.

authority.description: Indicates the authority who published the protocol.  E.g. ACIP.

series.description: One possible path to achieve presumed immunity against a disease - within the context of an authority.

seriesDoses.description: The recommended number of doses to achieve immunity.

doseStatus.description: Indicates if the immunization event should "count" against  the protocol.

doseStatusReason.description: Provides an explanation as to why an immunization event should or should not count against the protocol.
